article.title: Incidence geometry and universality in the tropical plane

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the vectors e1, e2, and e3 represent in the context of the tropical line shown?
choices: The center of the tropical line.
The slopes of the line segments forming the tropical line.
The directions of the rays (axes) of the tropical line.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the relationship between the two points determining the tropical lines shown?
choices: They are coaxial and determine a unique tropical line.
They are coaxial and determine infinitely many tropical lines.

multiple_choice_question.text: In a linear Newton subdivision, what does the polygon Pc,w1,w2,w3 represent?
choices: A cell in the Newton subdivision corresponding to a specific local arrangement of tropical lines.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this formula represent in the context of constructing universal subdivisions?
choices: The equation of a tropical line.
The area of a polygon in the Newton subdivision.
A constraint on the distances between intersections of tropical lines on a common vertical axis.
The definition of an exact metric.
